an8.36:0.4: Normally I try to avoid using “make merit” for punnam karoti, to avoid the modern materialist slant on it. But here the context suggests that this is just what the Buddha had in mind. the term is adapted from the Brahmins (MN 99). I think the point of the group of three is, “you don’t just make merit by giving (which was the highest form recognized by the brahmins) but also by ethics, and hey, even meditation!. So here I think it’s best to use “meditation” by bhavana, even if the scope is actually somewhat broader than that; it doubtless refers to the 37 bodhipakkhiyas. Further, I think we should avoid over-literal translations.” basis for meritorious activity consisting in …'may be English, but not as we know it.sc1
